result.execSummary:
The defendant Todd J. Weckler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intentionally Mistreat Animals, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 951.02.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Door County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: $100 fine plus costs.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.
To pay restitution plus any statutorily authorized surcharges.
Maintain full-time employment as directed by Dept. of Corrections.
While on probation, acquire no new dogs for a period of 3 years. Limited to 2 dogs in the household. These dogs must be spayed or neutered.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

timeConds.notes: STAYED.  To be used at the Court's discretion by petition from probation agent. If stay is lifted, huber release is granted.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Todd J. Weckler in court. Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Katie Nelson appeared on behalf of DOC. Court reviews previous activity, questions Agent, who advises that Defendant is making his $5 payments, has no concerns with him. Court orders that Defendant continue to make payments. Agent can advise the Court if another probation review is necessary.
Probation review hearing on November 7, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Todd J. Weckler appears by phone.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DOC Agent Olivia Glesner present in court. Court reviews events in file, reviews sentence previously imposed. Court questions agent on whether any restitution payments have been made. Agent Glesner indicates defendant hasn't made any payments toward restitution/financial obligations. Defendant explains why he hasn't made any payments, can only pay about $5 per month. Court orders defendant pay $5 per month toward restitution/financial obligations. State requests another hearing be set in 6 months, would like defendant to provide DOC with documentation of medical treatment he's involved in. Court sets another hearing.  Probation review hearing scheduled for November 9, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
from ADA Korb requesting court set a probation review hearing.
Probation review hearing on May 4, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
New discharge date is 5/10/18.

Defendant Todd J. Weckler in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.
Witness fees due DA
Juror selection and peremptory challenges, random listing report, jury seating chart, voir dire list, juror sign-in sheet
State Exh. 1, 2, 3, 6, 7, 8, 9, 10, 11 all offered and received.

Defendant Todd J. Weckler in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews preliminary matters with counsel. Voir Dire begins. Oath of Qualification given. Jury chosen. Oath of Trial Panel given. Recess 9:45 am. Back in session. State/Defense give opening statement. Steve Petry testifies, sworn. Cross. Dep. Paul Keddell testifies, sworn. State Exh. 1 - photo's of Lucy. Offered and received. Cross. Bridget Isaksen testifies, sworn. Exh. 2 - photo of milk replacer can. Offered and received. Cross, redirect. Recess 11:24 am. Back in session 11:38 am. Dr. Deb Johnson testifies, sworn. State Exh. 11 - exam room photo of Lucy, Exh. 6 - intake form from exam of Lucy, Exh. 7 - Marshfield lab report for Lucy. Exh.'s 6, 7 & 11 offered and received. Recess for lunch 11:59 am. Back in session 12:48 pm.  Court discusses issue brought up by a juror. State/Defense don't see a problem, ready to proceed with trial. Testimony resumes with Dr. Johnson. State Exh. 10 - Dr. Johnson report of 3/07/16, Exh. 8 - Dr. Johnson report of 3/04/16, Exh. 9 - Dr. Johnson notes. Exhibits 8, 9 & 10 offered and received. Cross, redirect. Dr. Sherry Billett testifies, sworn. Cross. Jury excused. Court questions defendant on his right to testify. Court finds defendant is freely, knowingly & voluntarily choosing to testify today. Atty Korb objects to hearsay evidence being used that Defense may try to introduce during defendants testimony. Atty Gerbers responds. Discussion. State Exh. 3 - photos 3A - 3T. Offered and received. Recess 2:31 pm.  Back in session 2:41 pm. State rests. Defendant testifies, sworn. Cross. State recalls Dr. Johnson. Defense rests. Jury excused. Court reviews jury instructions with counsel. Recess 3:34 pm. Back in session 3:44 pm. Court instructs jury. State/Defense give closing arguments. State gives rebuttal argument. Court gives final instructions. Oath of Bailiff given. Jury to deliberations 4:44 pm. Discussion on exhibits to go to the jury. State/Defense agree that all exhibits can go if requested. Recess 4:45 pm.
Back in session 5:06 pm. Jury returns with verdict. Jury finds defendant guilty of Int. Mistreat Animals. Court polls jury. Jury excused. State moves for judgment on verdict. Court finds defendant guilty of Int. Mistreat Animals. Court sets off sentencing. Bond remains in effect. Sentencing 5/10/16 at 2:30 pm.
State's

Defendant Todd J. Weckler appears by phone along with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers who appears in person.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file.  Atty Gerbers just received discovery material and has reviewed it, needs to go through discovery with defendant. Atty Gerbers feels that can be done before the scheduled trial date. Court indicates matter is in the #1 position for trial. Matter will proceed as scheduled. Bond remains in effect.
Jury trial at 03-15-2016 08:30 am
Pre-trial conference at 02-29-2016 09:15 am

Defendant Todd J. Weckler in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Gerbers requests an adjournment of the January trial. Atty Gerbers indicates he has not received the discovery material from Atty Petrouske yet, would like to see that before proceeding. Court questions Atty Gerbers as to whether matter should be set for trial or a status. Atty Gerbers would like matter set for trial. State has no objection. Court will reschedule trial after March 1, 2016. Bond remains in effect.

Defendant Todd J. Weckler in court with attorney Eric Maciolek.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file. Atty Maciolek indicates Atty Gerber is free for that jury trial date, will put a note in the file for him. Pretrial scheduled for 12/21/15 will remain on the calendar. Bond remains in effect.

Defendant Todd J. Weckler in court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions Defendant, who is approved for representation through PD's office, but hasn't heard anything more. Bond continues as is.  Status conference scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 10:00 am.
for Withdrawal of Counsel

Defendant Todd J. Weckler in court with attorney Randall Walter Petrouske.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Petrouske indicates he and the defendant are in agreement with him withdrawing from the case. State asks court to set a status in November to see where defendant is at in retaining new counsel. Defendant feels he can have new counsel in place by November. Court grants Atty Petrouske's motion to withdraw. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
Court sets hearing

Defendant Todd J. Weckler in court with attorney Randall Walter Petrouske.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel. Defense waives reading of the complaint, enters not guilty plea. Court finds probable cause for bindover. Bond set.  Status conference scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 11:45 am.
